title: UK tells Roman Abramovich to give Chelsea sale money to Ukraine
snippets: UK government warns Roman Abramovich of last chance to give Chelsea sale proceeds to victims of Russia's war in Ukraine.
The British government is threatening Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich with legal action unless he donates billions from the sale of Chelsea Football Club to victims of the war in Ukraine.
The Russian oligarch was forced to sell up when he was sanctioned for his ties to the Kremlin - but the money remains frozen in a British bank account.
UK tells Abramovich to give Chelsea sale cash to Ukraine or face court Reuters
Sir Keir Starmer has warned Roman Abramovich that "the clock is ticking" for him to donate £2.5bn from the sale of Chelsea to Ukraine.
titles: UK warns Abramovich to give Chelsea sale cash to Ukraine or face court
UK issues ultimatum to Abramovich for Chelsea sale funds
Abramovich must pay £2.5bn from Chelsea FC sale to Ukraine fund or face court, Starmer says
UK tells Abramovich to give Chelsea sale cash to Ukraine or face court - Reuters
Starmer urges Abramovich to transfer £2.5bn from Chelsea sale to Ukraine
constructiveness_reason: This story informs readers about a significant development related to the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. It provides some insight into the actions being taken by the UK government, but does not offer a deep understanding of the situation or potential solutions.
summary: The UK government has warned Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich to donate £2.5 billion from the sale of Chelsea Football Club to victims of Russia's war in Ukraine or face legal action. The funds have been frozen in a British bank account since Abramovich was sanctioned for his Kremlin ties. Authorities have set a final deadline for the donation, emphasizing the urgency of compliance.

title: Oscars will be shown only on YouTube starting in 2029
snippets: The show was hosted by ABC for more than a half-century and reveals the latest major shakeup in Hollywood.
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences signed a multiyear deal with Google-owned YouTube to stream the Oscars globally starting in 2029.
YouTube will effectively be the home to all things Oscars, including red-carpet coverage, the Governors Awards and the Oscar nominations announcement.
The Oscars have aired on longtime partner ABC for five straight decades.

The Oscars are headed to YouTube - in a few years. "Beginning in 2029, the Oscars will broadcast exclusively on YouTube for free globally and on YouTube TV in the U.S.," YouTube announced. YouTube's coverage will include the red carpet, behind the scenes content, and Governors Ball access. The deal
YouTube announced that it has secured the global rights to Hollywood's biggest night, a major victory in the fight over live events.
The news highlights YouTube's growing dominance in the television space and a major shift as streaming takes on more live events.
titles: The Oscars to leave ABC and stream on YouTube starting in 2029
The Oscars are heading to YouTube in 2029

constructiveness_reason: actions: start; semantic: pos_sim=0.00, neg_sim=0.00; length_penalty=0.60 (<20 tokens)
summary: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences has signed a multiyear agreement with YouTube to stream the Oscars globally starting in 2029. After more than 50 years on ABC, the Oscars will be broadcast exclusively on YouTube, including red carpet events, nominations, and related coverage. The deal marks a significant shift from traditional TV to streaming platforms for major live events.

title: Senate approves defense bill with pay raise for troops
snippets: The Senate has given final passage to the annual National Defense Authorization Act, which raises troop pay by 3.8%. It also pressures Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to provide lawmakers with video of strikes on alleged drug boats near Venezuela.

The legislation also requires Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to provide Congress with video and materials related to strikes on suspected drug boats near Venezuela, as well as information on the Trump administration’s military activities in Latin America.

title: Polar bear in Canada adopts an abandoned cub
snippets: It's only the 13th known case of adoption out of the 4,600 bears studied for nearly five decades in the northern Canadian area.
A polar bear mom emerged from her den with one cub, but was later seen in Churchill, Manitoba, with two. Researchers say she likely adopted an abandoned cub, only the 13th case observed in 45 years.
titles: Polar bear mother adopts cub in rarely documented case

summary: Researchers in northern Canada have documented a rare case of polar bear adoption. A female polar bear in Churchill, Manitoba, was observed emerging from her den with one cub, but later appeared with two cubs. Scientists believe she adopted an abandoned cub, marking only the 13th documented adoption among 4,600 bears studied over 45 years.
